title: Digest: mol-witness-patrol
description: Patrol cycle 2: all quiet. Obsidian polecat stopped and cleaned up between cycles. No polecats active. No mail, no swarms, no timer gates. Deacon still stopped (known). Refinery running.

title: adj-adjutant-polecat-obsidian
description:
adj-adjutant-polecat-obsidian

role_type: polecat
rig: adjutant
agent_state: closed
hook_bead: null
cleanup_status: null
active_mr: null
notification_level: null

title: Digest: mol-witness-patrol
description: Patrol cycle 1: all quiet. Refinery running, no MRs queued. No polecats initially; obsidian appeared mid-patrol (status=done, idle at prompt). Nudged to start. Deacon stopped (known). No swarms, no timer gates, no cleanup wisps.

title: AdjutantV2: Session Bridge
description: Remote Claude Code multiplexer. Tunnel to real terminal sessions via tmux pipe-pane + WebSocket.

title: Phase 1: Session Bridge Core
description: Backend only. Get tmux <-> WebSocket working. Deliverable: Connect to an existing tmux session from a WebSocket client and see live output, send input.

title: SessionRegistry: in-memory + file persistence
description: Track all known sessions. ManagedSession interface with id, name, tmuxSession, tmuxPane, projectPath, mode, status, connectedClients, outputBuffer, pipeActive. Persist to ~/.adjutant/sessions.json.

title: SessionConnector: tmux pipe-pane output streaming
description: Attach to tmux sessions via pipe-pane, stream output through FIFO. Buffer partial lines, pass complete lines downstream. Stop pipe-pane when no clients connected. Periodic capture-pane for reconnect preview.

title: InputRouter: tmux send-keys input + interrupt
description: Route WebSocket input to tmux send-keys. Handle session_input and session_interrupt (Ctrl-C). Input queuing while agent is mid-response. FIFO delivery when agent becomes idle.

title: LifecycleManager: create/kill tmux sessions
description: Create tmux sessions with Claude Code. Kill sessions on demand. Workspace setup (primary, worktree, copy). Handle session discovery on startup.

title: WebSocket protocol v2: session_* message types
description: Extend WS protocol with session_list, session_create, session_connect, session_disconnect, session_input, session_interrupt, session_kill, session_permission. Server responses: session_list, session_created, session_output, session_raw, session_status, session_permission, session_ended.

title: Basic output relay: raw terminal bytes
description: Stream raw terminal bytes from tmux to WebSocket clients. Ring buffer (1000 lines) per session. Replay/skip on reconnect. No parsing yet.

title: Phase 2: Output Parser
description: Make the raw stream usable for a chat UI. Deliverable: WebSocket clients receive both session_output (structured) and session_raw (terminal bytes) for the same session.

title: ANSI escape code stripper
description: Strip ANSI escape codes for chat mode rendering. Use strip-ansi or equivalent. Keep raw bytes for terminal mode.

title: Claude Code output pattern recognizer
description: Recognize Claude Code output patterns: tool use markers (Read/Edit/Bash), agent messages, tool results, permission prompts, status indicators (thinking/working), cost/token output. Best-effort parsing.

title: Dual emission: structured events + raw bytes
description: Emit both OutputEvent[] (structured) and raw string for each chunk. Client chooses which to render. OutputEvent types: message, tool_use, tool_result, status, permission_request, error, raw.

title: Phase 3: iOS Chat Overhaul
description: Replace mail-based chat with session-connected chat. Deliverable: Open Adjutant, tap an agent, see its live output, type prompts.

title: SessionChatView: WebSocket v2 session-connected chat
description: New SwiftUI view that connects to a session via WebSocket v2. Replaces mail-based ChatView for live sessions. Shows streaming output and accepts input.

title: Hybrid renderer: chat bubbles + tool cards
description: Render structured OutputEvents as chat bubbles (agent messages) and collapsible tool cards (Read/Edit/Bash). Show tool inputs and truncated results.

title: SwiftTerm integration: terminal mode toggle
description: Embed SwiftTerm widget for raw terminal view. Toggle between chat mode and terminal mode. Send raw bytes to SwiftTerm. Full ANSI color support.

title: WebSocket v2 client: session message support
description: Extend iOS WebSocketClient to handle session_* message types. Session connect/disconnect, input sending, interrupt, permission responses.

title: Stop button (Ctrl-C) + reconnect replay option
description: Stop button visible while agent is working (sends session_interrupt). On reconnect, offer replay buffer vs skip to present. Connection indicator: LIVE/BUFFERED/OFFLINE.

title: Phase 4: Session Lifecycle
description: Create, manage, and kill sessions from iOS. Deliverable: Create a project, start an agent, chat with it, stop it. All from iOS.

title: Projects REST API: CRUD + clone + activate
description: POST /api/projects (create from path, clone URL, or empty). GET /api/projects (list). POST /api/projects/:id/activate. DELETE /api/projects/:id. Persist to ~/.adjutant/projects.json.

title: Sessions REST API: create/list/kill
description: POST /api/sessions (create tmux + claude). GET /api/sessions (list active). DELETE /api/sessions/:id (kill). Workspace setup: worktree, copy, or primary.

title: iOS: Project management view
description: New top-level view listing projects with agent counts. Create project (clone/open/new). Tap project to see agents, start/stop, switch modes.

title: iOS: Agent switcher + start/stop controls
description: Sidebar or bottom sheet listing all active sessions with status. Tap to switch. Start/stop agent buttons. Show session status (IDLE/WORKING/PERMISSION).

title: Phase 5: Swarm Mode
description: Multi-agent orchestration without GT infrastructure. Deliverable: Spin up N agents on one project, watch them work in parallel, merge results.

title: Swarm creation: N agents in worktrees
description: Create N tmux sessions + worktrees for one project. Each agent gets its own branch. Configurable workspace strategy (worktree vs copy).

title: Coordinator pattern: designated merge agent
description: One agent designated as coordinator. Reviews and merges other agents work. Lightweight refinery pattern.

title: Dynamic scaling: add/remove agents from iOS
description: Add Agent creates new worktree + tmux session. Remove Agent kills session, optionally removes worktree. Live agent count in UI.

title: Branch merge UI: see branches, trigger merges
description: Show agent branches in iOS. Trigger merge back to main. Conflict detection and resolution flow.

title: Phase 6: Permissions & Polish
description: Permission system, cost tracking, session persistence, bandwidth optimization.

title: Permission system: config + detection + routing
description: Per-agent permission config (auto-accept / manual). Detect permission prompts in output parser. Route permission_request to iOS. Send y/n response via tmux send-keys.

title: iOS: Permission dialog + push notifications
description: Show permission dialog when agent requests approval. Push notification if app is backgrounded. Permission response routing back to backend.

title: Cost/token tracking: parse + store + stream
description: Parse cost/token output from Claude Code sessions. Store in ~/.adjutant/costs.json. Stream via WebSocket session_cost events. Per-session and per-project aggregation. Cost alerts.

title: Session persistence + bandwidth optimization
description: Survive backend restarts (reconnect to tmux sessions). Throttle/buffer raw output for slow clients. Delta compression. Persistent pipe-pane log files for full history.
